# The Hackett Group, Inc. (HCKT) - Comprehensive Analysis Report

## 1. Company Overview

The Hackett Group, Inc. operates as an intellectual property platform-based generative artificial intelligence strategic consulting and executive advisory digital transformation company serving clients in the United States, Europe, and internationally. The company focuses on enabling Digital World Class® performance through its proprietary platforms, AI XPLR and ZBrain, and serves a wide range of leading global businesses including a significant portion of the Dow Jones Industrials, Fortune 100, DAX 40, and FTSE 100. 

The company's expertise is grounded in unparalleled best practices insights from benchmarking the world's leading businesses – including 97% of the Dow Jones Industrials, 90% of the Fortune 100, 70% of the DAX 40 and 51% of the FTSE 100. Founded by Ted A. Fernandez and David N. Dungan in 1991 and headquartered in Miami, FL.

## 2. Current Market Data

• **Stock Price**: $19.55 (as of January 2026)
• **Market Capitalization**: $530.68M
• **52-Week Range**: $17.53 - $34.02
• **P/E Ratio**: 50.87
• **Dividend Yield**: 2.4%
• **Price Target**: $27.50 (analyst consensus)
• **Analyst Rating**: Moderate Buy (based on 3 analysts offering recommendations)

## 3. Existing Products/Services

The Hackett Group operates through three main business segments:

**Global Strategy & Business Transformation (Global S&BT):**
The Global S&BT segment includes the Company's Gen A.I. and strategic business consulting practices.

**Consulting Services:**
The company provides benchmarking services that conduct studies for selling, general and administrative, finance, human resources, information technology, procurement, enterprise performance management, and shared services; operational assessments, process and organization design, change management, and application of technology.

**Technology Solutions:**
- Hackett AI XPLR™ integrates unmatched Digital World Class® performance and process intelligence to help identify client-specific breakthrough AI solutions and produce an agentic workflow design in days, not months
- ZBrain™, the Gen AI orchestration platform designed to streamline operational workflows and optimize processes

**Oracle & SAP Solutions:**
Oracle solutions that help clients to choose and deploy oracle applications; SAP solutions, including planning, architecture, and vendor evaluation and selection through implementation, customization, testing, and integration

## 4. Planned Products/Services/Projects

**Recent Platform Launches:**
• **AI XPLR™ 5.0**: Launched to support enterprise AI Centers of Excellence (AI COEs), designed to accelerate and enhance how enterprises identify, evaluate, and design AI solutions using their client-specific business processes, enterprise applications and data landscape
• **XT™ and AIXelerator™**: New Gen AI-assisted platforms to complete full suite of offerings

**AI Platform Evolution:**
AI XPLR™ 3.0 introduces thousands of industry-specific AI solutions and tens of thousands of AI agents, helping organizations ideate, evaluate, and deploy Gen AI solutions tailored to their unique business needs – in hours or days, not months.

## 5. Growth Strategy

The company's high-margin, recurring-revenue, Gen AI growth strategy is powered by its Hackett AI XPLR™ and ZBrain™ software platforms, and its recognized Digital World Class® performance IP.

**Strategic Focus Areas:**
• Aggressive investment in the highly differentiating AI XPLR platform and growing Gen AI revenues
• Anticipation of accelerated growth in GenAI revenues in Q4 and into 2026, driven by AI Explorer and ZBrain platforms
• Platform licensing opportunities for enterprise clients

## 6. Current and Potential Major Clients

The company benchmarks the world's leading businesses – including 97% of the Dow Jones Industrials, 90% of the Fortune 100, 70% of the DAX 40 and 51% of the FTSE 100.

**Award Recipients and Clients Include:**
• Companies using artificial intelligence to transform their end-to-end business process performance through the Hackett Innovation Awards
• Major corporations across procurement, finance, HR, and IT functions

## 7. Financial Data & Performance

**Q3 2025 Results:**
• **Revenue**: $73.1 million for Q3 2025, a decrease from $79.8 million in the same quarter of the previous year
• **Adjusted EPS**: $0.37 (meeting guidance midpoint)
• **GAAP EPS**: $0.09, impacted by non-cash compensation expenses and restructuring costs
• **Cash Balance**: $13.9 million, up from $10.1 million in the previous quarter

**Q4 2025 Guidance:**
Fourth-quarter revenue before reimbursements expected to range between $69.5 million and $71.0 million, with adjusted diluted earnings per share expected to be between $0.38 and $0.40.

**Shareholder Returns:**
• Board approved additional $40.0 million share repurchase plan with approximately $52.6 million available for share repurchases. Company announced plan to launch a modified "Dutch auction" tender offer to purchase up to $40.0 million in value of common stock at $18.30–$21.00 per share.

## 8. Market Shares

While specific market share data is limited, the company has established positions in:
• **Benchmarking Services**: Industry leader with extensive database
• **Gen AI Consulting**: Emerging position in rapidly growing market
• **Oracle & SAP Implementation**: Established player in enterprise software services

## 9. Comparison to Competitors

**Major Competitors:**
Top competitors include McKinsey, Deloitte, EY, Accenture, Bain & Company, BCG and Cognizant

**Competitive Advantages:**
• Unique standout feature leveraging the world's largest repository of empirical benchmarking data and best practices to precisely quantify performance gaps and ensure technology investments deliver measurable ROI
• Unmatched business context to the agentic orchestration layer, providing proprietary business performance and process intelligence and automation context

**Key Differentiators vs. Big Consulting:**
• Niche expertise in core business functions versus broader, end-to-end organizational perspective from large, full-service consulting firms

## 10. Partnerships, Mergers and Acquisitions

**Recent Acquisitions:**
• **LeewayHertz**: Gen AI development firm acquisition to strengthen technological capabilities
• **Spend Matters™**: Completed acquisition in May 2025 of a leader in the procurement and supply chain solutions market intelligence sector, founded in 2004 to transform procurement through technology and thought leadership

**Strategic Partnerships:**
• Strategic alliance with Celonis enhancing AI Explorer platform with process intelligence capabilities, expected to accelerate growth and create significant channel expansion opportunities

## 11. Recent Developments

**2025 Key Milestones:**
• Release of AI XPLR V4 in September receiving positive feedback and expected to drive future growth by attracting new clients and channel partners
• Named a 2025-2026 Best Companies to Work For by U.S. News & World Report
• Forbes named The Hackett Group® among the World's Best Management Consulting Firms and jointly recognized by Brandon Hall Group for employee learning certification program

## 12. AI Investment Rating & Fair Value Assessment

**Investment Rating: 7/10**

**Rationale:**
**Strengths:**
• Strong AI platform differentiation with proprietary IP
• Recurring revenue model with high-value enterprise clients
• Established market position in benchmarking and best practices
• Recent acquisitions strengthening capabilities
• Management's aggressive investment in Gen AI platforms

**Concerns:**
• Q3 2025 revenue decline and margin pressure during transition
• Smaller scale compared to major consulting competitors
• Execution risk in transitioning to AI-first business model
• Market volatility affecting client spending

**Fair Value Estimate: $24-26**

The current analyst price target of $27.50 appears reasonable given the company's transformation to AI-first consulting, strong client relationships, and unique market positioning. However, execution of the Gen AI strategy and revenue stabilization remain key factors. The stock trades at a premium valuation but could justify higher multiples if the AI platform strategy succeeds in driving growth acceleration.

**Recommendation:** Moderate Buy for growth-oriented portfolios with appetite for transformation stories in the AI space.
